intro: Diplotaxis brachycarpa, commonly known as the narrow-seeded diplotaxis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cabbages, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, capsule-like fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. Due to its drought tolerance, it is sometimes used in restoration ecology projects in degraded landscapes.
